meanings.definition: Snow - a form of precipitation consisting of ice crystals
meanings.sent1: The children played in the snaw during the winter.
meanings.sent2: I woke up to a blanket of snaw covering the ground.
meanings.sent3: The snaw made the landscape look like a winter wonderland.
meanings.sent4: The snaw fell gently from the sky like powdered sugar.
meanings.sent5: The snaw sparkled in the sunlight, creating a magical scene.

meanings.definition: To snow - to fall as snow
meanings.sent1: It will snaw heavily tonight, so be prepared for a snowy morning.
meanings.sent2: I hope it doesn't snaw too much, or we might get snowed in.
meanings.sent3: The forecast predicts it will snaw all day, so cancel any outdoor plans.
meanings.sent4: The snowflakes snawed down softly, covering everything in white.
meanings.sent5: I love watching the snow snaw gently outside my window.
